items.title: Uber, Stellantis, Nvidia, and Foxconn make a robotaxi deal
items.summary: Robotaxi fever is back, baby! After a bunch of automaker-led autonomous driving projects shut down amid concerns over safety and costs, car companies are expressing a renewed interest in self-driving cars, and robotaxis specifically. Stellantis, which oversees brands like Jeep, Ram, Dodge, and Chrysler, announced today a “new collaboration” with a diverse range of firms, […]

items.title: U.S. consumer confidence index slightly declines
items.summary: NEW YORK, Oct. 28 (Xinhua) -- The U.S. Conference Board Consumer Confidence Index released on Tuesday stood at 94.6 in October, down one point from upwardly revised 95.6 in September, but better than the market expectations of 93.4. Read full story

items.title: At least 60 dead in Rio de Janeiro police operation, local media reports
items.summary: (Reuters) -At least 60 people died, including four police officers, in an operation against organized crime in Rio de Janeiro on Tuesday, broadcasters GloboNews and CNN Brasil reported, a death toll more than double official figures released earlier in the day. Read full story

It’s among the lightest gaming mice out there, and you can learn more about it in detail below.

items.title: Black Friday PSA: PlayStation 5 consoles will be at least $120 off this year
items.summary:
It seems as though retailers are becoming more and more vague about what the actual deals will be come Black Friday in ads and early marketing materials. That said, some retailers still subscribe to the old school way of doing things and actually dish up specific prices on upcoming deals, and even the exact date they will go live. Costco is, to some degree, one of these retailers and it is already teasing a notable upcoming PlayStation 5 deal.

That low price is coming back around now, giving you a $250 markdown at the best tracked price on a more compact autonomous cleaner.

items.summary:

For folks who missed out on the early-bird deals, you can pick up the power station on its own for $799 shipped, which is also matching in price over at Amazon. It will normally fetch $1,499 at full price once these launch deals end, with the folks who subscribed and scored the code ahead of time getting an additional $50 off the price for $749 shipped. These are the very first savings of $700 and $750 off the going rate, setting the bar for future deals. items.title: TechCrunch Disrupt 2025: Day 2
items.summary: Second day of TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 at San Francisco's Moscone West. Here's the rundown on what to expect, including the 50% discount on passes for remainder of the event.

items.title: Greenworks’ folding 80V 21-inch self-propelled and adaptive SmartCut mower at a $380 low (Reg. $580+, Today only)
items.summary:
As part of its Deals of the Day, Best Buy is offering the Greenworks 80V 21-Inch Self-Propelled Lawn Mower with a 4.0Ah battery at $379.99 shipped, which beats out Amazon’s pricing by $220. While it fetches a $600 MSRP at Amazon, you’ll find it starting at a slightly lower $580 full price here, with discounts having taken the costs as low as $380. That low price was only seen once this year, back in June, with it returning here through the rest of the day to give you an upgraded and more eco-friendly means to tackle your lawn with $200 savings.

more…

items.title: Today’s best iOS app deals and freebies: Old Man’s Journey, ELOH, Dead Cells, more
items.summary:
Tuesday morning’s best deals on iOS games and apps courtesy of the App Store are ready and waiting for you down below. On your way down be sure to scope out the deals we are tracking on the M4 MacBook Air lineup at $200 off, this Midnight 16GB M3 MacBook Air at $659 off the original price, and the best Amazon price ever on this 1TB M3 iPad Air at $370 off. Score some Apple USB-C cables from $6.50 while you’re at it, and then head below for a closer look at today’s app deals.  

more…

items.title: Amazon to cut 14,000 corporate jobs
items.summary: Amazon said on Tuesday that it plans to reduce its corporate workforce by 14,000 jobs as it seeks to reduce bureaucracy, remove layers, and invest more in its AI strategy.

items.title: Switch 2 game deals now live: Zelda BotW, Tears of the Kingdom, DK Bananza, Kirby, Mario Party, more
items.summary:
Discounts on first-party Switch 2 games are still a relatively rare occurrence. We have seen some price drops here and there, but today Woot has brought back its deals on Donkey Kong Bananza, Mario Kart World and the official Switch 2 Editions of Zelda: Breath of the Wild, Tears of the Kingdom, Kirby and the Forgotten Land, and Super Mario Party Jamboree. There’s no telling how long these deals might stick around for, but if you’re looking to land proper Switch 2 boxed editions to your library, have at them below:

  • Donkey Kong Bananza $62 (Reg. $70)
  • Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild – Switch 2 Edition $63 (Reg. $70)
  • Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom – Switch 2 Edition $70 (Reg. $80)
  • Mario Kart World $70 (Reg. $80)
  • Kirby and the Forgotten Land – Switch 2 Edition + Star-Crossed World $70 (Reg. $80)
  • Super Mario Party Jamboree – Switch 2 Edition + Jamboree TV $70 (Reg. $80)
more…

items.title: Reports Claim Major Gmail Security Breach; Google Denies Incident
items.summary:
Google has refuted claims of a large-scale Gmail security breach following online reports suggesting that millions of user passwords had been leaked. The company clarified that the allegations were rooted in a misunderstanding of older stolen data being recirculated, not from a new attack against Gmail. In a post on its official News from Google […]
